column4: What is the runlevel when I switch to a virtual console (Ctrl-Alt-F1) ?
2 (the same as the gui)
okay thanks
You may need to tweak your VGA boot settings
okay, where might I find it?
In your /boot/grub/menu.lst, does your latest boot option have vga=<somthing>?
nope, there is none. What should I add?
so, this line 'kernel /boot/<bla> root=<stuff> ro quiet splash' has no vga=<somthing>
yep that's right. I have this "kernel          /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.28-15-generic root=UUID=f58a2a33-2a85-4e31-8ea
try adding vga=795 to that line
that is, if you have a 1280x1024 monitor
okay thanks.. I have a 1280x800 monitor.. where can I find references for the vga= option?
I would try vga=792 (the boot splash will look weird but it should work). Refer to http://paste2.org/p/453148
okay... thanks for the link :) much appreciated. so now I know the keywords are vga, framebuffer mode
i'll be right back, try out your solution
did it work? (my X-server crashed so I missed a few posts)
Thank you so much for the help! The link you gave me, it has framebuffer modes in hexadecimal, did you convert the hex (0x315) to decimal (792) ?
yes it worked :) I haven't tried shutting it down yet, but virtual consoles are now perfectly usable
oops wrong conversion, correct one is 0x318 == 792
Your bootsplash probably looked a little stretched because I gave you the vga for 1024x768 because 1280x1024 is supported by few BIOSes.  You can try setting vga=864 but this may not work.
I've looked around, there is no support for 16:10 screens?
there is, it is just rare (google '1280x800 vga nvidia')
i have read something about vbetest on gentoo.. To show my monitor's vga FB modes. What is the equivalent for Ubuntu?

864 doesn't work. It says "undefined mode. Press ENTER to see a list of choices." and 1280x800 framebuffer isn't supported. I reverted to 792. Splash screen is moved a bit to the side. Thanks so much for your help :) I updated my thread here with credits to you http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1282338
